alert.note: Alert for Mills; Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 14 at 8:07PM CDT until April 14 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MILLS...WESTERN POTTAWATTAMIE AND NORTHEASTERN SARPY COUNTIES... At 806 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Underwood to 6 miles south of Council Bluffs Airport to 2 miles northeast of Plattsmouth, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 736 PM, a 67 mph wind gust was recorded at Offutt Air Force Base. In addition, these storms have a history of producing quarter to half dollar sized hail. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Underwood around 810 PM CDT. Council Bluffs Airport around 815 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Treynor. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
